Name: Prescription Drugs and Pets, Removal From Buildings
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency procedures for the removal of prescription drugs and pets from dangerous buildings and property.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1.	Title 26 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 26-127.3 to read as follows:
      �26-127.3  Removal of prescription drugs and pets from unsafe buildings and property.  a. For the purposes of this section, the following words shall have the following meanings:
      1.  "Emergency response agencies" means the departments of fire, police, environmental protection, health, transportation and sanitation, and the division of emergency medical services of the health and hospitals corporation.
      2.  "Prescription drugs" means any drug which may be dispensed only with a physician's prescription.
      b.  Upon ordering or causing the evacuation of any building, structure, place or premises deemed perilous to life or property pursuant to section 26-127 of this code, the commissioner shall notify occupants that they may not have an opportunity to return to the building, structure, place or premises for an extended period of time and that such occupants should remove any prescription drugs or pets in a reasonable period of time as specified by the commissioner or the designee of the commissioner.
      c.  The commissioner shall allow reasonable efforts for the removal of any prescription drugs or pets upon ordering or causing the evacuation of any building, structure, place or premises deemed perilous to life or property pursuant to section 26-127 of this code.  Such efforts shall include requiring authorized officers and employees of the city to enter such building, structure, place or premises to secure or remove such prescription drugs or pets as expeditiously as possible.  The owner of such prescription drugs or pets shall provide such information as necessary for the removal of such prescription drugs or pets.
      d.  The commissioner, in consultation with the emergency response agencies, shall by rule establish emergency evacuation procedures designed to allow for the implementation of this section.
      �2.  This local law shall take effect sixty days after it shall have been enacted into law.
